name: Water Quality
data_intro: Access to safe drinking-water is essential to health, a basic human right and a component of effective policy for health protection. This is important as a health and development issue at a national, regional and local level. In some regions, it has been shown that investments in water supply and sanitation can yield a net economic benefit, since the reductions in adverse health effects and health care costs outweigh the costs of undertaking the interventions.

num_feature_intro.ph: The pH level of the water, indicating its acidity or alkalinity.
num_feature_intro.Hardness: Capacity of water to precipitate soap in mg/L.
num_feature_intro.Sulfate: Amount of Sulfates dissolved in mg/L.
num_feature_intro.Conductivity: Electrical conductivity of water in μS/cm.
num_feature_intro.Organic_carbon: Amount of organic carbon in ppm.
num_feature_intro.Turbidity: Measure of light emiting property of water in NTU.
num_feature_intro.Potability: Indicates if water is safe for human consumption. Potable -1 and Not potable -0.
